edu.mines.jtk.util

Class ParameterSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mines.jtk.util.ParameterSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ParameterSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Externalizable
    A parameter set - a collection of named parameters and parameter subsets. A parameter set forms a tree in which the parameters represent leaf nodes and parameter subsets represent branches.
    See Also:
    Parameter, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParameterSet()
      Construct an empty nameless root parameter set.
      ParameterSet(java.lang.String name)
      Construct an empty named root parameter set.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Clone this parameter set. The clone will be an orphan; its parent parameter set will be null.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a clone of this parameter set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException

      • replaceWith

        public ParameterSet replaceWith(ParameterSet parset)
        Replace the contents of this parameter set with a copy of the contents of the specified parameter set. Do not change this parameter set's parent.
        Parameters:
        parset - the parameter set with contents that will replace those in this parameter set.
        Returns:
        this parameter set, with contents replaced.

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the parameter set name.
        Returns:
        parameter set name.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the parameter set name.
        Parameters:
        name - parameter set name. If the parameter set has a parent parameter set, ignore a null name.

      • getParameter

        public Parameter getParameter(java.lang.String name)
        Get a parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the parameter to get.
        Returns:
        parameter; null, if the parameter set does not contain a parameter with the specified name.

      • getParameterSet

        public ParameterSet getParameterSet(java.lang.String name)
        Get a parameter subset.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the subset to get.
        Returns:
        subset; null, if the parameter set does not contain a subset with the specified name.

      • addParameter

        public Parameter addParameter(java.lang.String name)
        Add a new parameter to this parameter set. If this parameter set already contains a parameter or subset with the specified name, replace that parameter or subset with with the new parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the parameter to add.
        Returns:
        parameter; null, if name is null.

      • addParameterSet

        public ParameterSet addParameterSet(java.lang.String name)
        Add a new parameter subset to this parameter set. If this parameter set already contains a parameter or subset with the specified name, replace that parameter or subset with with the new parameter subset.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the parameter subset to add.
        Returns:
        parameter subset; null, if name is null.

      • getBoolean

        public boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String name,
                 boolean defaultValue)
                   throws ParameterConvertException
        Get the boolean value of a named parameter in this parameter set.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the parameter.
        defaultValue - default value returned if this parameter set does not contain a parameter with the specified name.
        Returns:
        parameter value or default value.
        Throws:
        ParameterConvertException - if the parameter value cannot be converted to boolean.

      • copyTo

        public ParameterSet copyTo(ParameterSet parent)
        Copy this parameter.set to the specified parent parameter set without changing its name.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parameter set into which to copy this parameter set; the parent of the destination parameter set. If the parent is null, the destination parameter set will be an orphan.
        Returns:
        the destination parameter set.

      • copyTo

        public ParameterSet copyTo(ParameterSet parent,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Copy this parameter.set to the specified parent parameter set while changing its name.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parameter set into which to copy this parameter set; the parent of the destination parameter set. If the parent is null, the destination parameter set will be an orphan.
        name - the destination parameter set name.
        Returns:
        the destination parameter set.

      • moveTo

        public ParameterSet moveTo(ParameterSet parent)
        Move this parameter set to the specified parent parameter set without changing its name.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parameter set into which to move this parameter set; the parent of the destination parameter set. If the parent is null, the destination parameter set will be an orphan.
        Returns:
        the destination parameter set.

      • moveTo

        public ParameterSet moveTo(ParameterSet parent,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Move this parameter set to the specified parent parameter set while changing its name.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parameter set into which to move this parameter set; the parent of the destination parameter set. If the parent is null, the destination parameter set will be an orphan. The parent cannot be this parameter set or a subset of this parameter set.
        name - the destination parameter set name.
        Returns:
        the destination parameter set.

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Remove this parameter set from its parent parameter set. In other words, orphan this parameter set. If this parameter set is already an orphan, do nothing.

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String name)
        Remove a named parameter or subset from this parameter set. If this parameter set does not contain a parameter or subset with the specified name, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the parameter or subset to remove.

      • countParameters

        public int countParameters()
        Count the parameters in this parameter set.
        Returns:
        number of parameters in this parameter set.

      • countParameterSets

        public int countParameterSets()
        Count the parameter subsets in this parameter set.
        Returns:
        number of subsets in this parameter set.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear this parameter set by removing all its parameters and parameter subsets.

      • getParent

        public ParameterSet getParent()
        Get the parameter set that contains this parameter set.
        Returns:
        parent parameter set; null, if the parameter set is a root parameter set with no parent, perhaps because it was orphaned by removing it from its parent.

      • getParameters

        public java.util.Iterator<Parameter> getParameters()
        Gets an iterator for the parameters in this parameter set.
        Returns:
        the iterator.

      • getParameterSets

        public java.util.Iterator<ParameterSet> getParameterSets()
        Gets an iterator for the parameter sets in this parameter set.
        Returns:
        the iterator.

      • fromString

        public void fromString(java.lang.String s)
                throws ParameterSetFormatException
        Replace this parameter set with that represented in the specified XML-formatted string (the same format written by method toString).
        Parameters:
        s - XML-formatted string representation of parameter set.
        Throws:
        ParameterSetFormatException - if the string is not properly formatted.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get a string representation of this parameter set. This XML-formatted string represents the parameter name and all parameters and subsets contained in this parameter set.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of this parameter set.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares two parameter sets for equality. Parameter sets are equal if their names and any contained parameters and parameter sets are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true, if the parameter sets are equal; false, otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Computes the hash code of this parameter set.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hash code.

      • writeExternal

        public void writeExternal(java.io.ObjectOutput out)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Serializes this parameter set by writing its XML string representation to the specified object output.
        Specified by:
        writeExternal in interface java.io.Externalizable
        Parameters:
        out - the object output to which to write this parameter set.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O exception occurs.

      • readExternal

        public void readExternal(java.io.ObjectInput in)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                         ParameterSetFormatException
        Restores this parameter set by reading its XML string representation from the specified object input.
        Specified by:
        readExternal in interface java.io.Externalizable
        Parameters:
        in - the object input from which to read this parameter set.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/exception occurs.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class for an object being restored cannot be found.
        ParameterSetFormatException - if the XML string representation of this parameter set is not properly formatted.
